wikipedia_page.main: Matthew McLintock Scott (11 July 1872 – 14 August 1941) was a Scottish footballer who captained Scotland against Wales in the 1897–98 British Home Championship. He played most of his career at Airdrieonians, but also played for one season at Newcastle United and Albion Rovers. As a footballer, he was considered a "powerfully built full back."

response: *Matthew Scott (footballer, born 1872) (1872–?), Scottish footballer (Airdrieonians FC and Scotland)
*Matthew Scott (footballer, born 1867) (1867–1897), English footballer for Sunderland
*Matthew Scott (rugby league) (born 1985), Australian rugby league footballer
*Matthew Scott (Stargate), fictional character in Stargate Universe
Scott's brother, Matthew Scott, also played for Airdrieonians and played for Scotland in 1898.
